Content:: Lal Dharmapriya Gamage (born 9 February 1954) was a Sri Lankan politician[1] and the former Minister Assisting Foreign Affairs. He is an architect by profession[2] and was educated at Nalanda College Colombo.* "Old Nalandians elected MPs to be felicitated". Daily News. Archived from the original on 2002-04-02. Retrieved 2002-03-27. Gamage was elected to parliament at the 9th parliamentary election, held on 15 February 1989, as the United National Party representative, in the Anuradhapura electorate.[3]
Title: Lal Dharmapriya Gamage - Wikipedia
